docs.snippet: Why bombing Syria now is a bad decision that draws America into a new war with no plan for long-term consequences.
docs.lead_paragraph: Why bombing Syria now is a bad decision that draws America into a new war with no plan for long-term consequences.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Pres Obama's decision to put America at center of widening war by expanding airstrikes against Islamic State into Syria; contends Obama has done so without allowing public debate about whether to enter another costly and lengthy conflict in the Middle East; calls on Obama to obtain Congress's approval for military action.

headline.main: Wrong Turn on Syria: No Convincing Plan

docs.snippet: Monarch butterflies are famous for migrating from the U.S. and Canada to Mexico for the winter. Now a surprising study suggests the species itself also started out in North America some 2 million years ago.

docs.snippet: Global soccer has taken some well-earned flak in recent years, but this edition of the game's showcase event has been a golden ticket to compelling action.
docs.lead_paragraph: Global soccer has taken some well-earned flak in recent years, but this edition of the game's showcase event has been a golden ticket to compelling action.
docs.abstract: Christopher Clarey On Soccer column argues that 2014 World Cup has been marked by exceptional action, dynamic play and stunning upsets; notes that only six teams from oft-dominant Europe have made it to the second round, the lowest number in cup history, reflecting rise of teams from the Americas and elsewhere.

headline.main: A World Cup of the Americas Ends Upbeat First Phase
headline.print_headline: Americas Rise in Thrilling First Phase

docs.snippet: Events in Missouri are the latest opportunity for news media and the government to portray the United States as a hypocritical critic of speech restrictions.
docs.lead_paragraph: Events in Missouri are the latest opportunity for news media and the government to portray the United States as a hypocritical critic of speech restrictions.
docs.abstract: Russian broadcasts of police crackdown on protestors in Ferguson, Mo, are being used to portray American critics of Russia as hypocrites; Russia points to unrest in Ferguson as proof that racism and restriction of free speech are present in country that meddles abroad under pretext of defending human rights.

headline.main: In Russia, Scenes From Ferguson Are Played as Nothing Shocking: It’s America
headline.print_headline: In Russia, Scenes From Ferguson Are Played as Nothing Shocking: It’s America

docs.snippet: American forces took advantage of the strikes against the Islamic State in Syria to try to also wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell that the White House said was plotting against the United States or Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: American forces took advantage of the strikes against the Islamic State in Syria to try to also wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell that the White House said was plotting against the United States or Europe.
docs.abstract: American forces take advantage of airstrikes against Islamic State extremist group in Syria to try and simultaneously wipe out leadership of Khorasan, unrelated cell of veterans of Al Qaeda; Obama administration says group was plotting 'imminent' attack against the United States or Europe.

headline.main: In Airstrikes, U.S. Targets Militant Cell Said to Plot an Attack Against the West

docs.snippet: Streaming from a Bronx apartment, it is perhaps the only radio show in the U.S. to broadcast in the fading Ecuadorean language of Kichwa.
docs.lead_paragraph: Streaming from a Bronx apartment, it is perhaps the only radio show in the U.S. to broadcast in the fading Ecuadorean language of Kichwa.
docs.abstract: Bronx resident Segundo J Angamarca is hoping his Internet radio show will help revive fading Kichwa language, Ecuadorean variant of indigenous South American language Quechua; he is among handful of New Yorkers with Ecuadorean roots who speak the dialect.

headline.main: By Using Language Rooted in Andes, Internet Show’s Hosts Hope to Save It
headline.print_headline: By Using Language Rooted in Andes, Internet Show’s Hosts Hope to Save It
